key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA data reveals a very high missing offer rate (approx. 75.7%) accompanied by a consistent price premium (0.78%), indicating significant discrepancies compared to the airline website.
MSE observations show a dominant offer visibility issue (74% missing offers) with a modest premium (0.05%), although frequency trends are declining over recent periods.
GDS performance is characterized by a dominant N/A status (around 75%) and persistent higher pricing with an average premium of approximately 1.2%, despite some short-term declines.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Approximately 75.7% of origin-destination pairs register as 'website offer not found' on OTA, indicating major content discrepancies with the airline website.
There is a consistent OTA HIGHER observation at around 22.3%, with a price premium maintained near 0.78% across segments.
OTA LOWER instances are rare (around 0.1%), confirming that underpricing relative to the airline website is virtually negligible.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: OTA shows a high N/A frequency of 75.74%, with increases of 19.05% week-over-week and 41.95% month-over-month, indicating rising missing offers.
SAME status is minimal (approx. 1.8%), signifying that exact price matches with the website are uncommon.
Despite a decline in OTA HIGHER frequency from 40.2% to 22.3%, the price premium remains steady between 0.78% and 0.98%.
OTA LOWER discrepancies exhibit only minor negative differences (around -0.26%), confirming minimal impact from lower pricing.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul segments show a 74.4% N/A rate and a 23.7% HIGHER frequency with a premium of ~0.78%, aligning with overall OTA trends.
Long haul records experience an 80.3% N/A rate with a slightly lower 17.7% HIGHER frequency and a comparable premium near 0.77%, suggesting uniform regional behavior.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Domestic routes (CN) have a 74.8% N/A and 23.7% HIGHER frequency with a premium of approximately 0.84%, mirroring overall trends.
Non-CN itineraries display higher SAME status and a reduced HIGHER frequency of 13.1% with almost no premium (0.04%), indicating a divergent pricing pattern.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For close in bookings, a very high N/A frequency (93.1%) is observed alongside a low HIGHER frequency of 6.4%, but with a significant premium of approximately 1.21%.
Extended bookings see a drop in N/A frequency to 35.4% with a dominant 59.4% HIGHER status and a moderate premium near 0.67%, indicating differentiated pricing strategies.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE reports a high missing offer rate (~74%), with noticeable week-over-week and month-over-month increases.
MSE HIGHER events register a modest, yet consistent, price premium of about 0.05% despite declining frequencies.
Instances of MSE LOWER pricing are minimal, with an average discount of -0.06%, showing limited underpricing.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: MSE N/A status dominates with a frequency of 0.7422, highlighting a significant gap in offer visibility relative to the website.
SAME status is very low (around 0.0112), indicating that exact price matches are scarce.
MSE HIGHER observations occur at 20.27% with a stable premium of 0.05%, even as overall frequency declines.
MSE LOWER frequency remains low (approx. 4.39%), with only a minor discount effect averaging -0.06%.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: For short haul routes, the N/A frequency is about 72.87% with a 21.71% HIGHER rate and a small 4.57% occurrence of LOWER pricing.
Long haul segments show a higher N/A rate (78.67%) with a slightly reduced incidence of premium pricing at 15.51%, reflecting larger discrepancies.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Domestic routes exhibit a N/A frequency of 73.62% and a HIGHER rate of 23.25%, with negligible LOWER occurrences (2.23%), indicating tighter premium levels.
Non-CN itineraries show a higher N/A frequency of 78.09% and an elevated LOWER pricing rate (18.28%) coupled with a lower HIGHER incidence (1.09%), suggesting contrasting pricing strategies.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close in bookings are characterized by an overwhelming N/A frequency (91.91%) with minimal price premiums (5.72%) and discounts (1.93%), indicating constrained pricing variations.
Far out bookings reflect a strategic shift with a 54.14% incidence for HIGHER pricing and a lower N/A frequency of 33.04%, aligning with advance purchase pricing tactics.

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS data shows a dominant N/A status with approximately 75% frequency and strong upward trends (19% PW and 42% PM increases).
The GDS HIGHER status, despite declines (16.5% PW and 36.7% PM), consistently features an average premium around 1.2%.
An overall average price difference of 0.39% indicates that, despite discrepancies, the aggregate pricing gap remains modest.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: GDS displays a dominant N/A frequency of 75% LW with increases nearing 19% PW and 42% PM, underscoring reliance on non-matching offers.
Exact price matches (SAME status) are very infrequent at approximately 2% LW, highlighting considerable pricing divergence.
GDS HIGHER pricing events, noted at 22.91% LW, maintain a consistent price premium ranging from 1.13% to 1.26% despite slight declines.
GDS LOWER instances remain almost negligible (<0.2% LW) with minimal discount effects, reaffirming a focus on higher pricing.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul itineraries register a N/A rate of 73.8% LW with a HIGHER premium averaging around 1.02%, reflecting standard pricing discrepancies.
Long haul segments exhibit a higher N/A frequency (78.9% LW) and an increased HIGHER premium (approx. 1.63%), indicating more marked pricing variations.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For CN itineraries, GDS shows a N/A rate of about 74% with a HIGHER premium averaging nearly 0.97%, suggesting moderate discrepancies.
Non-CN routes reveal an elevated N/A frequency (81%) and a significantly higher HIGHER premium of around 2.77%, highlighting a larger pricing gap.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close in bookings have an extremely high N/A frequency at 92.4% LW with a HIGHER premium of about 1.40%, indicating deferred alignment with website fares.
Far out bookings show a lower N/A frequency (34.4% LW) while maintaining a consistent HIGHER premium of approximately 1.06%, in line with standard pricing practices for advanced purchases.
